intro: Hieracium subterdentatum, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
